review_text: You will love to see priceless religious artifacts.
First time to visit the Capilla Sta. Ana, it is a museum of sorts of almost all Patron Saints of the Catholic Church owned by the prominent family here the Lebumpacil. ‚Ä¶
It's my first here in Capilla Santa ana located in Toledo City Cebu the museum is great aircondetioned.The maze is truly amazing
A very good place to visit when in Toledo City, Cebu
There's many artifacts in the chapel, there are even bones of saints ü§Ø. We went there at the right time, the labyrinth was properly trimmed that day. ‚Ä¶
I love the place... my second time to visit.
So expensive for a minute visit
Awesome place where saints abide! You will find a cool  and amazing labyrinth in this chapel. Come and visit the place to saints, statues, doors, relics and ornaments!

Had the luxury of going there without other guests in the area. A good place to unwind and have a sense of fulfillment right after the labyrinth is accomplished at the center. Got to find the shortcut though. Haha. Yeah, there is.

There were grass cuts on the maze walk way. The maze was one way, we thought it crosses paths with other directions... But it looks amazing on pictures btw!
We paid 100 for entrance, that includes a tour inside the chapel. A lot to see inside the chapel too!
I love this place so much,, I feel a holy place
closed when we arrived, though, we enjoyed the adjacent garden called Labyrinth.

It looks grand on the pics but its actually just a small scale juranta(not sure of the spelling)-maze. It was quite fun but their chapel is closed due to the pandemic and ongoing renovations. Entrance to the labyrinth is 100/person.
The labyrinth looks interesting and great for us catholic to finish our holy Rosary.. inside thier private beautifull  church is thier relics and artifacts ..you guys must visit here
This is a treasure trove of religious artifacts.

An air-conditioned private chapel with a labyrinth garden on its side.
Good place for a private church wedding or photo shoot.
As of April 2021, it has an entrance fee of PHP 100.00 per person.

A privately owned Chapel and Museum located in Toledo City, Cebu. Inside are relics of saints, religious icons and antique statues from Europe that were acquired by the owners in their travels. However, you are not allowed to take pictures ‚Ä¶
Ok ya know na po is a good day to imo order na po was

This place is owned by a private owner. They have a church and put every collection they have to make the Church good. When you will go to this place you need to pay Php100.00 to cover the maintenance. After that entrance fee you can discover what they have inside the church and their maze.
Entrance fee of 100 for the museum tour and the labyrinth maze.
Nice place and quite.. A place you think and think..

I had a great experience in this place.
I wanted to back  here with my family and friends. üòáüôèüòçüòäüòä ‚Ä¶

Nice collection of pieces for the chapel. It is clean and air conditioned. The guide said that all except two are from overseas. The labyrinth is a nice touch and cleverly designed such that you have to walk all those paths to get to the ‚Ä¶
Labyrinth is very interesting. You get to pay 100 pesos though for the curator inside the museum.

You can take pictures outside the church, inside the church, and in the labyrinth garden. There are rooms where they keep relics like the wood stained with the blood of Jesus, old robes of a pope, and the like. In these rooms, picture taking is not allowed. There is an entrance fee here of Php100.
If you happen to be in Toledo, the mini museum is quite interesting. Staff was very accommodating.
i was lost in this maze üòÇ ‚Ä¶

Beautiful privately owned chapel with a small museum with a collection of religious relics from europe including a shard of the true cross of jesus, reliquary of actual bones of saints, hundreds of years old bible, and many more. Dont forget to visit the outdoor labyrinth garden outside for a nice little photo op.
I love the maze!üòçüòç Although their entrance fee is too pricey for that short pictorial time. ‚Ä¶
I came to see the hedge garden. If you are into catholic religious artifacts, you can check out the chapel. Entrance fee is P100.
Great place.. Soon I will visit again
The entrance rate of 100 pesos per person is too expensive and there is really not much to see.

If you like religious artifacts, this will be a good place for you. The variety of their relics, from small to life-size statues, are amazing. The labyrinth is the best for me. Capturing photos in the museum is prohibited. Entrance fee is php100.00.
This is an amazing catholic church that showcases antique museum and a labyrinth garden... Anyone visiting Toledo City should not miss this nice place üëçüôè ‚Ä¶

Not worth to travel if you are on a 3D2N. It is a small place. The labyrinth is small and not tall. To go here, you need to travel 2 1/2 hours by bus (Toledo Bus - South Terminal Station) 80 pesos/pax. Entrance fee is 100. Going back to Cebu City there's a Van terminal at Super Metro.
Great place, a lot of relics from different centuries from different part of the world
Authentic collections of Relics and historical statues

A very beautiful private chapel. Religious relics, artifacts, centuries old paintings  are well preserved. All collections are acquired from Europe except for the three Sto. Nino which were locally sourced. Outside is an equally beautiful labyrinth where you can relax and pray.

A private chapel with a hedge garden and well-stocked museum.

Artifacts and relics are 90% from Europe, and the collection is just superb in ‚Ä¶
airconditioned church. entrance fee of 100/pax. they could have improved the maze if its really a Maze with wrong turns but is overall good place
Capilla Santa Museum is a private museum one of a recomended touris spot in  Cebu this Museum  desplayed antik relics and statue of saints since 21 century
Nice place..so good to see those century relics from europeüòçüòÆ ‚Ä¶
The place is beautiful and you can also take a tour to Capilla Sta. Ana to know more. I didn't notice any signage outside, I still need assistance from google maps.
Nice place. Especially if you like to see religious collection
A museum of fine relics collected by the owner itself. I like the labyrinth

It's really a private chapel where masses are by request and you bring your own priest. Prepare Php100 per person for the entrance fee and make sure to keep the receipt because the guard will check it upon exit. There's a free tour about ‚Ä¶
Entrance fee is 100 php. Its airconditioned and the staff is friendly. Check out the Labyrinth as well and take some photos.

It was a wonderful experience.

The moment you enter the parking area you would think that you just came for the ‚Ä¶
Very solemn place. Great place for meditation and spiritual guidance. Visit also their labyrinth and garden. Staff are very much accommodating.
Cultural and full of history. Guides are well knowledged about their stuff.
Something new to discover with friends. Get lost in this labyrinth and find its path to reach the center..
A great place to learn about our faith and see things that are out of the ordinary like the 100 bones of 100 saint and other church relics and things.
Nice place for a pre nup & etc.
The history and relics is mind boggling. A must to visit if your in the area.
the chapel is okay and the maze is unending but it was all okay for the views
The place was well-known of their labyrinth but they also have a nice collection of religious antiques. Their guide are good and very accomodating.
We came for the maze, but the tour inside the chapel is a must. From authentic relics to historical items, robes, bible, and much more.. check it for yourself üòÅ ‚Ä¶
A very nice chapel with lots of religious artifacts that can be found inside. They also offer a guided tour around to know more about the artifacts. ‚Ä¶
A must visit place in Toledo.
This place renewed my faith in God.

I love the story of how the owner decided to set this museum in her hometown and give back to her community without returns.
The musuem cum private chapel charges a small sum of Php100 which may seem hefty ‚Ä¶
If you are a catholic and interested in antique religious items, paintings and etc this is a good place to go.
Nice place, instagram worthy place. Entrance fee of 100 for Local Tourist, 200 for Foreign Tourist, and 50 for kids. They tour you around the chapel, the history of the things inside. ‚Ä¶
This is a private chapel. Some relics and artifacts which aligned to Roman Catholic were displayed in their museum.
Amazing tour! Very informational and the price is also reasonable. Had a great time üòä ‚Ä¶

Very nice antiquities of the Catholic Church.  Also, the coldest place in Toledo.  They keep the air conditioning set very cold for the Philippines to preserve the paintings and artifacts.  The Labyrinth is not really a maze, as it has only ‚Ä¶
Travel worthy! Amazed by the collections and the Labyrinth Garden. a-MAZE-ng :)
